ca.utoronto.csc301.SelfCheckOut.App
Class ProductDB

java.lang.Object
  ca.utoronto.csc301.SelfCheckOut.App.ProductDB

public class ProductDB
extends java.lang.Object

The ProductDB class encapsulates the list of all products sold in the store. In a real system, this would likely be a wrapper around a database of products which would be managed elsewhere. In our sample system, we have a method which can provide a sample DB, and the capability to add items to the DB using an addItem() method.

Constructor Summary
ProductDB()
          Constructs an empty database.
 
Method Summary
 void addItem(ProductInfo item)
          This method is called to add items directly to the database in our example.
 void initializeTestDB()
          This test method constructs a sample database which is useful for testing purposes.
 java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,ProductInfo> listAll()
          This method returns a copy of the ProductDB Hashtable.
 ProductInfo lookUpItem(Code code)
          This method looks up a product in the database.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

ProductDB

public ProductDB()
Constructs an empty database.

Method Detail

initializeTestDB

public void initializeTestDB()
                      throws java.lang.Exception
This test method constructs a sample database which is useful for testing purposes. Products may also be added individually using the addItem() method.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

listAll

public java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,ProductInfo> listAll()
This method returns a copy of the ProductDB Hashtable. If we provided the original, external code could modify the DB directly.

lookUpItem

public ProductInfo lookUpItem(Code code)
This method looks up a product in the database.

Parameters:
code - The UIC or BIC of the product.
Returns:
The ProductInfo of the corresponding product, or null if no such product.

addItem

public void addItem(ProductInfo item)
This method is called to add items directly to the database in our example. In a real implementation, this would likely be done directly to the product database using a separate piece of software.

Parameters:
item - The product to be added.
